attributes.background:
The Hull Daily Mail and East Riding Mail, serving soldiers, and parents of troops killed by roadside bombs, call upon the Prime Minister to withdraw all ‘soft-top’ Land Rovers from war zones with immediate effect – and for him to announce now a fixed date for the delivery of the entire fleet of new Mastiff vehicles to troops.
More than 20 British soldiers have been killed in Land Rovers in Iraq and Afghanistan.
The Mail has spoken to several soldiers in recent weeks who have been serving in Iraq as part of the 1st Battalion, The Yorkshire Regiment.
Three soldiers provided pictures and video footage of ‘soft-top’ Land Rovers being used on patrol, even though the MoD denied they were being used. The soldiers and their families say it is putting at extra risk.
